comment: Dr. Dockery always does a pre-lab lecture and he covers information that you might not know prior to doing the lab procedure. It is useful later for completing the lab reports. He drops your lowest lab grade and 2 lowest lab quiz grades at the end of the semester. He answers questions and is overall chill.

Professor Dockery is very reliable and understanding about Notebook grades and Lab participation. He always provided clear instruction and wants his students to succeed. If I had him for any other class in the future, he would be my number one pick.
Dr. Dockery is an amazing lab instructor. He grades graciously and leniently, is very kind and can be fun too. I don't know if he's the same in lectures, but 11/10 would recommend for lab.

UNDERSTAND that 1212 is not 1211. 1212 is very math heavy and just because you had success in 1211 doesn't mean the same for 1212. The labs are very straightforward and his pre-lab lectures give you all the information you need to get a perfect score on the lab work. If you have questions regarding lecture, ask as he is knowledgable and will help.

Super caring and helpful!! lab report on labflow is longg but expected for this class. always accessible outside of lab and on GroupMe. he explains the lab procedures IN DETAILS for every lab -> very helpful. he even helpoed me with some chem 1212 lectures concepts. Chemistry requires hard work! TAKE HIM TAKE HIM TAKE HIM!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: He's the most patient professor I've had. He really cares and is always very helpful. Very accessible outside of class. Easy A if you show up to lab, and he always explains the lab procedure in the beginning and always is open to questions.

He is a very lenient grader and class is very enjoyable. Would take this class with him. Will expect you to remember everything from gen chem and quant chem, and wont really go over it but thats my only complaint. He is very knowledgeable and loves what he teaches. He is an easy professor, but honestly if you dont pay attention you may not learn.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took him for lab he was very helpful and was very accessible outside of class. He gave us constant reminders so we wouldn't get behind.

My favorite lab instructor. Very nice and understanding. He is so helpful during the labs and doesn't make you feel dumb for asking any questions. Make sure you do every assignment. If you are confused on a lab, don't be afraid to ask questions because he is always willing to help. The hardest lab was the titration one.

Dr. Dockery is one of the best professors Ive had a KSU. Hes kind, caring, and very helpful! He will do everything he can to help you when youre struggling. He even will help you understand the lab too! He wants you to pass and do well! All the lectures are online, make sure you copy everything he does bc it wont be online but its very helpful

Lectures are hard to understand but he was always accessible outside of class (mostly used in the class group chat). He was very understanding when my internet went out in the middle of a test and graded the test from pictures. The homework was pretty similar to the tests and some of those questions reappeared on the test with different numbers.

Sweet guy! Easy to talk to and will help you out, but his lectures are hard to understand. The tests are super hard! Im not one to struggle with chemistry, it comes easy to me. But this class was a struggle!! Beware!

His lecture practice questions are nothing like the test. There are 5 tests including the final (ACS). He does homework from mastering chemistry. We never used the textbook. He tries his best to teach the hard material but it makes no sense. I would not take his lecture again!

Dr. Dockery is an amazing professor; you can tell from his lectures how invested he is in the material. His grading criteria is very straight-forward-- he isn't there to trick you. His assignments are geared to reiterate the lectures and enhance learning the material, alongside two projects, and three exams. If you have the opportunity, TAKE HIM!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Dockery is a great professor. Attendance isn't required, and many people only show up for the test. He has a few homework grades, but they aren't hard at all. Basically do them, and you'll get the grade. Two projects (easy and straightforward) and 3 tests (2 exams and a final) that are all short answer. Very good prof who loves what he does.

I honestly love Dr. Dockery!! His tests are straightforward; make sure you do a lot of practice problems in the textbook and read the chapters. I literally found the same type of questions from the practice questions in the book! His lectures can be a bit boring and fast but reading the chapter helps. He's always there for office hours.

Dr. Dockery is an amazing personality. He tries really hard to make chemistry interesting, but the way he teaches makes it really hard to learn. The long lectures make note taking a challenge. Tests are very difficult in comparison to practice test and worksheets. If you take him, be prepared to study!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Dockery is so smart that he doesn't know how to teach well and cater to students' needs. Took him for Chemistry 1212 lecture and got a C. Talks so fast you can't keep up! Class starts and doesn't stop talking until it ends. The class goes so fast-paced. Helpful during reviews but tests are not nearly the same level of difficulty. RUN

Honestly, if you just show up, you will pass. The pre-lab lectures are so well explained, you will not have any problems with the lab. The pre-lab quizzes are easy. He not one of those professor that make you copy everything in your lab notebook. If you needed help, he was always available.

Dr. Dockery was a great teacher and you can tell that he was passionate about what he was teaching. He really did care about us and gave a lot of bonus. Lectures are straight to point but if you want to pass the class with an A, you have to read the textbook as well. I think one he is probably one of the best Chem 1212 teachers at KSU.
Lab is lab. He is very helpful and knows how to explain things.

Professor Dockery is a great professor who is willing to help students learn! His office hours are a great way to understand any content that was not understood in class! He always has a cool personality, and makes jokes every now and then. Definitely take him for CHEM 1212 Lab! He is a fair grader and you will not regret it !
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very good choice for CHEM1212. He gives practice exams! If you don't understand something just ask him 1 on 1. Final exam was curved.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Dockery is a amazing teacher. The class is hard and you do have to show up. Ask question and GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS he will help you in anyway possible. I am a adult learning that had not had chemistry in over a year and was able to pull off a B in his class. The homework is not that bad and do the practice tests they do help.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: His tests are difficult. I would prepare by understanding the practice test, and still do poor on exams (the later in the semester, the less the practices resemble the test). He is very monotone, and not the best at explaining concepts. However he is very helpful when you get 1 on 1 help during in class assignments. Not a bad choice, but not great.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Good choice for chem 1212. He gives practice tests that resemble the actual test. Easy B if you're good in chemistry, have to work for an A. Need masteringchemistry for homework assignments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Would take again

comment: work on his practice exam, really helpful. sometimes he puts the same question on the exam.

There are only 4 tests (one dropped) each has only 15 mc questions on it. He has built in extra credit on the tests but not much. He explains concepts well in class and provides test study material, however in class work is a lot easier than tests and you learn the most from the mastering chem hw online. Hw questions help you pass tests. Do the hw.
He is a great professor. I really liked Dr. Dockery he is clear and a great professor. He keeps the class interesting and he is passionate about forensic chemistry. His tests are tough but fair.

I wondered how he could be a second chair at his age, and it was obvious if you see his earnest attitudes. I sent him an email around 1:00 am and expected that I'll receive answers in afternoon but he actually respond at 5:00 am. and his class is hard definitely, but his style is so helpful for your career. Take his class! it will help you.

He is glad to help you and is VERY speedy responding to emails about anything. He gives a little extra credit. There is required online HW, and it prepares you for the tests. He gives study guides for the tests as well. Just show up to class every day, do the homework and you will do fine.

Dockery is nice but he is very monotone and teaches purely off slides. Barely used book except to study. Homework is long and harder than tests but it will prepare you for the actual test. Gives you free points if you attend friday class. You need to study in order to get a good grade in this class.

Mr. Dockery knows his stuff. his power points are great, many print them off from GVV. He is happy to answer any questions regarding the lab, even if you don't have him for lab. The homework assignments are lengthy and somewhat tedious but they help you understand the material.

Professor Docker is a good teacher. He breaks the material down, and he waits to see if people still have questions for him. All of his notes are ViewVista. All of his tests are 15 questions, each question counts for 14 points, so he gives somewhat of a bonus. He drops the lowest test grade, and compared to the other trachers he is beter.

Took Dockery for Gen Chem II over Summer 2011. Made an A in the class (with hard work). Dockery is a good prof, but his voice is very monotone. Don't take him at 8:30 am or you WILL zone out. I NEVER used the book, everything important is in his slides. DO HIS PRACTICE EXAMS, they are extremely helpful & some questions match exam questions!

Nice guy but he has a hard time breaking the material down to students in this class. He's not easy, you have to study your butt off in this class and if you dont have an easy schedule you'll run into trouble. He words the question weird. I liked him as a person but as a prof not so much. If you can take someone else, do it. If not he's alright
Must keep up with the class to do well. He's a nice guy, but can be unclear on what will be on the tests. Must study and do lots of practice problems.

Dr. Dockery is an extremely nice guy and so helpful. If you have problems, he is always in his office. Its important to keep up with reading and notes... do as many practice problems as you can. Honestly, this class is really dry but it is not one you can slack in. I totally suggest him.

Fair chance to make the grade you are willing to work for.  Dr. Dockery was always available for help and promptly responded to emails even over the weekend.  I worked very hard in his class and it paid off.  Tests were multiple choice, one of which was dropped and online quizzes were averaged to account for 1 exam grade.

He was one of the best lab professors I have had. Really enthusiastic about class, helps prepare the students so they can get in and out as fast as possible. I would take him again for my lab for sure. If you do the work and follow the guidelines, easy A for sure
He is an amazing teacher!  always available

Very good professor. Always, responds to e-mails quickly and makes himself available for help.Material is hard and he does a good job teaching it.Tests are straight forward, they are always similar problems to the once in the readings or the onces practiced in class. For the ones who thought the test were hard, they definitely didn't do work.

I had another chem teacher and did so much better in their class than I did in his. I did all the quizzes, homeworks, practice exams, went to class everyday, went to tutorial and still did not pass the class. Tests are difficult and misleading. Five multiple choice answers where any 2-4 of them could be a possible answer if you solve it incorrectly

he's a loveable teacher. I enjoyed his class. Yes, you need to study but then again if you think that you can get an awesome grade in chemistry without having to study then you shouldn't be taking chemistry at all then.
Dockery isn't a bad as some here have claimed. Study the material, go to class, do the practice exams and recommended problems and you'll pass. He's an alright professor and willing to help.
Hardest prof at kennesaw, i took this class with another teacher and did SO much better! AVOID AVOID AVOID AT ALL COST!

This is the hardest chem professor at kennesaw.  I took this class with another teacher and got a high B but i failed his test.  He is very unclear about what exactly he wants you to know.  Avoid at all cost!! avoid!!

he's a really nice guy. anyone who gives him bad comments are the lazy students in the class who have no interest in science anyway.  The subject is not so hard really if you read and do homework problems to practice you will do fine. His powerpoints are helpful he gives you old practice exams. All mc tests. just do be lazy and slack!!!

This is a hard subject with a lot of material to cover in a short amount of time.  He does a WONDERFUL job of breaking down the material and explaining it easily.  He has great WEBCT materials and is always available for extra help.  Chemistry isn't my best subject but I made with his help I made it through.
Dockery knows what he is talking about BUT very hard to follow along with. I love Chemistry but not with this professor.

Dr. Dockery is one of the best science professors I have ever had.  Chemistry 1212 is an extremely difficult course, content wise.  I couldn't imagine have taken someone else.  All the tests are multiple choice. He explains things very well, he is very organized, and will help you outside of class.  With hard work, you can make and A.
DO NOT TAKE! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
How am i supposed to do good if i don't know what to study?

Doesn't care about his students, just cares about getting paid, like many professors these days. Don't take if you ever want to feel good about Chem. or feel good the semester you have him. Gives you no clue what will be on tests. Awful.

Class was not bad, just do the reading/homework and you were fine.  Dockery is a wonderful professor, do not be afraid to ask questions in class or out.  I changed him to my advisor--do your share and you will do fine.  I made a C b/c I didn't always put forth the effort, so that was my fault.

Basically, everything is very clear and he teaches straight out of powerpoints. The tests were easy, i didn't go to class (except the first ones) at all, and had a good grade. Take him. if you go to class, pay attention, do the homework and read the book,, ure acing the class : )

I honestly didnt like this class, he was very hard and didnt seem to want to help out. he once got mad at the class because he gave us a pop quiz on stuff we just learned and we didnt know it. then in lab he wasnt too clear about how he wanted the reports and so everyone got bad grades because he didnt give us a clear outline on how he wanted it.

Dr. Dockery is a pretty good prof. his lectures however are every boring, they're straight from the text book. In most cases the book explains stuff better than his lectures, so just read the book. his tests are not too hard if you study well.

A great professor....he is the type you would want to have for Chemistry.  He goes through the material quickly, but all of his lectures and pp slides are straight from the book...I would definitely recommend him and take him again in the future.

dr doc is by far one of the best chem professors! very helpful, doesnt make u feel uncomfortable asking questions. very down to earth man. at 1st, i thought this class was going to be hard as no other, but i just did the work and now i have an A. humorous and a nice man. he's so great that i plan to do researching with him l8r, and that says a lot.

Dr. Dockery is an excellent teacher...he posts power point slides for every lecture and is very helpfl if you don't understnad...he expects everyone to work hard and fast, so plan to study...can make a good grade if you go to class and keep up with the homework...excellent teacher, I can't wait to take him for more classes!!
